page.title: 04HOUSING IN TICKHILL
page.content: 60 per cent of{housing}in Tickhill has been built since 1961,and about 40 per cent since 1971. This extensive building has caused the number of dwellings to rise from about 850 in 1961 to just over 2000 in 1985.Most of the older buildings are clustered around the Buttercross or line the main streets.Many of them are difficult to age,some are of{medieval} foundation.There are several good examples of tall elegant{18th century} houses especially along Sunderland Street.Many of the older houses are made of stone.Some are made not with dressed stone but with poor stone and have had to be rendered or repointed. Many of the new houses have been built in{estates}around the village.These mainly family houses have been built from brick.New houses amongst older buildings are built from stone.
